alert.note: Alert for Mendocino Coast; Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Northern Lake County; Northwestern Mendocino Interior; Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior; Southern Lake County; Southern Trinity; Southwestern Humboldt; Southwestern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 19 at 9:41PM PST until January 20 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM PST SATURDAY THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Southern Humboldt, Southern Trinity, Mendocino County, and Lake County. * WHEN...From 4 AM PST Saturday through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A storm system will start to bring rain along the coast during the day Friday, helping to saturate soils. More consistent, moderate to heavy rain will fall during the day Saturday with total rainfall of 2 to 4 inches most likely. Additional rainfall will is the expected by Monday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
